title: Keen pictures I drew when I was a kid
content:
I have been a keener since I was a kid, uhh, yeah, I'm still a kid but since I was like...4-5 years old?
I drew alot, not that I was good at it, but anyways.
Today I took my time and searched for all those drawings I made, too bad I only found a few.
2 pictures and one...uhh..Dunno what to call it ._.
Anyways, I really want to show you these...masterpieces of doom (Keen). So well - here they are!

This is the first one, dunno when I drew it actually, but it was a long time ago.
One of the enemies is from 'Keen 2000' for those who doesn't recognize it... (Also, there's an apperance of an enemy from the lovely game 'Pandemonium'.)

[img]http://img250.imageshack.us/my.php?image=keenwithenemiesth4.jpg[/img]


---

The second one:

[img]http://img441.imageshack.us/my.php?image=keensketchql4.jpg[/img]


---

This is a, well, don't know what to call it actually. (I'm Swedish ._.)
This is On swedish to, so I guess I have to translate: (Just a reminder, I drew this when I was about 7 years old, so my Swedish-spelling really sucked)


The front and back of the 'book':

[img]http://img441.imageshack.us/my.php?image=frontandbackofkeen4fw0.jpg[/img]



The first and second pages:

[img]http://img441.imageshack.us/my.php?image=page12sa7.jpg[/img]

"Keen is going to use the nuclear silo"



The third and fourth pages:

[img]http://img441.imageshack.us/my.php?image=page34zs0.jpg[/img]



The fifth and sixth pages:

[img]http://img166.imageshack.us/my.php?image=page56er8.jpg[/img]


"No, the glass is broken. He might die."

"Noooooooo, Keen Died."

"The End."

---

The last pictures is the last episode of a smal series I made.
I don't really understand so much myself, you see. ._.

As I said before, have in mind that I drew this when I was VERY YOUNG. I'm not much of an artist now either... <,<
Well...Enjoy, and have a good laugh xD

EDIT: I have enlarged the pictures.

title: Re: Keen pictures I drew when I was a kid
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]"Noooooooo, Keen Died."

"The End."[hr][/quote]
HEY! It's just like when I PLAY Commander Keen!

Heh... nice pictures. Worth a giggle or three. The pictures ARE a little small though, can't you make them any bigger?-----------------------
The end of this post. You may stop reading now.

title: Re: Keen pictures I drew when I was a kid
content:
The "SLUT" part was unexpected, but of course that's just Swedish for "end". [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img]

Hm, you must be a pretty young member (actually, I was 3 or 4 when Keen started existing, but we didn't have a computer to run the game on until about 5 years later).____________
Don't see me as an ordinary man.
Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]

Although, when I was a little older (10 or 11, I think), I drew a lot of levels, characters, and stuff related to Keen, as if I was designing my own game or something (I wasn't...) [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

title: Re: Keen pictures I drew when I was a kid
content:
From here: [url=http://www.dosclassics.com/ckn/newsletter/issues/2002-06-22.txt]CK Newsletter issue 2002-06-22[/url]

[quote]Quote:[hr]I said something about this already in first question, but I can tell again..
Well, I have always dreamed to make something cool for Commander Keen. When I
was young I and my friend planned Keen levels to paper, though we haven't any
idea how to make them. And ofcourse papers are lost, they would be cool in
Commander Keen Vault's fan art section. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] [hr][/quote]

*sigh*. I never planned complete levels, but parts of them, with new enemies and stuff. They're just hidden in the dust of my lair. Now that I have the tools to materialize them, I don't feel like being able to.

Perhaps we could put our unfinished drawings all there as a gallery? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-spotkeen.gif[/img] I'll start with my most recent drawing:

[img]http://i144.photobucket.com/albums/r176/shadowm2006/shikadisentry.jpg[/img]------------------------------

title: Re: Keen pictures I drew when I was a kid
content: I have large numbers of character drawings from Commander Keen lying around in various places.  A lot of concept drawings also...all very cartoony, and of varying quality depending on when I drew it and how hard I was trying.  In any case, nothing too interesting I don't think...[img]http://i91.photobucket.com/albums/k284/KeegTech/WarholDopefishPNG2.png[/img]

title: Re: Keen pictures I drew when I was a kid
content:
I drew a huge series of Keen enemies and came up with little stories and whatnot for them, all of which I've long since forgotten, back in the third and/or fourth grade. My ultimate plan was to contact iD and give them all my ideas and get them to make my Keen game... or to make it myself, I don't remember. Either way, it was an utterly futile plan, and most of the concepts were really dumb anyways. Elvis Keen? A giant robotic Kenny suit? And what was a third/fourth grader doing watching South Park? And was that show really on that long ago?

I DON'T KNOW!!

title: Re: Keen pictures I drew when I was a kid
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]My ultimate plan was to contact iD and give them all my ideas and get them to make my Keen game...[hr][/quote]

Ha ha, I've done that, too. I sent them a whole long story for TUIT... It was actually pretty stupid.-Genius314

title: Re: Keen pictures I drew when I was a kid
content:
When I was like 5 years old or something I designed a couple of Commander Keen levels. I remember that there was an evil crayon that could turn itself invisible, and a one-eyed thing that hopped around, among other things I have forgotten. The level itself had parts that were both platform-style and 8-directional, making it so that it really didn't make any sense.

Later I came up with a bunch of new enemies like a spiky thing that threw deadly dimes at you; a robot that walked around on its heels, which had spikes on them; a dinosaur thing that could carry you across spikes but ran at 70 miles an hour...some other wierd things...I still have all those put together in a book simply titled "Good Guys and Bad Guys." No mention of story or anything.[img]http://i91.photobucket.com/albums/k284/KeegTech/WarholDopefishPNG2.png[/img]

title: Re: Keen pictures I drew when I was a kid
content:
My goodness this takes me back a bit. I never did any drawings per se, however I did mess with screencaptures a lot. There was some old DOS program you could use, like DosBox, but far simpler, you'd get a bitmap image every time you pressed F4 + F5 + F6. Those were the fun days of paint and messing about with cut and copy.[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v499/Nevad/menbun.gif[/img]

Awww! Feel the love!

title: Re: Keen pictures I drew when I was a kid
content: I still use paint for all my computer-drawing purposes.  I just never felt like I needed to learn anything else.  And it works well enough for pixel art.[img]http://i91.photobucket.com/albums/k284/KeegTech/WarholDopefishPNG2.png[/img]

title: Re: lol
content:
(garg, ezboard won't let me log in, so I can't edit posts.)

And as for Keen drawings I've done, I made tons of levels with all sorts of clever ideas. The very first one was when I was like five and was inspired by some "video game" drawing that was hanging up on the wall of the dentist's office - the hygenist's nephew or something had drawn it. I remember the Keen level was drawn in marker involved some sort of mine cart on tracks that snaked down the page, and that was pretty much it as far as I can recall. I honestly do not know how I remember this - perhaps partly because my parents told me about it? But then how would I know what the level looked like? They certainly don't remember ... the mind is a mysterious thing ...

Anyway, I graduated to drawing the levels with a pencil (more detail). I don't remember making any Keen drawings on the computer ... apart from a couple of screenshot tweaks, like LLa said.

I also drew a couple of Keen comics - more like "graphic novels" I guess. The only plot element I can remember now is that some nasty creature snuck into Keen's B-w-B Megarocket and switched the labels on the LAUNCH and SELF-DESTRUCT buttons. Keen got in, pressed what he thought was the LAUNCH button, and ... I don't remember how he got out of this situation ... he didn't die anyway ("SLUT", lol).

Wow, it's been fun thinking about this stuff.

Edit: (now it lets me edit!) Next time I'm home I'll try to remember to grab some and scan and upload them. I probably won't though, to be honest.

It was fun seeing other people's early Keen drawings! I'll try to reciprocate!

title: Re: lol
content:
If you're not logged in, how are you posting now?

I remember laboriously copying out Keen sprites by hand, pixel by pixel and making what were, in essence, sprite comics with them. (In a poor imitation of the Keen palette.) Me and my brother could spend *hours* on one picture, rearranging stuff to make a story, all that'd be saved in the end was the final 'frame' of the pic.

Aaah, simpler times...Szevvy Forever!
And Spleen never!

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/rcwn.jpg[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord
